trans-unit.source: Strips the white space in a string.

seg-source.mrk: Strips the white space in a string.

target.mrk: Strips the white space in a string.

trans-unit.source: Flag to indicate the type of stripping that should be performed (add the flags together for multiple operations):

seg-source.mrk: Flag to indicate the type of stripping that should be performed (add the flags together for multiple operations):

target.mrk: Flag to indicate the type of stripping that should be performed (add the flags together for multiple operations):

trans-unit.source: $STR_STRIPSPACES (4) = strip double (or more) spaces between words

seg-source.mrk: $STR_STRIPSPACES (4) = strip double (or more) spaces between words

target.mrk: $STR_STRIPSPACES (4) = strip double (or more) spaces between words

trans-unit.source: $STR_STRIPALL (8) = strip all spaces (over-rides all other flags)

seg-source.mrk: $STR_STRIPALL (8) = strip all spaces (over-rides all other flags)

target.mrk: $STR_STRIPALL (8) = strip all spaces (over-rides all other flags)

trans-unit.source: Returns the new string stripped of the requested white space.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the new string stripped of the requested white space.

target.mrk: Returns the new string stripped of the requested white space.

trans-unit.source: Whitespace includes Chr(9) thru Chr(13) which are HorizontalTab, LineFeed, VerticalTab, FormFeed, and CarriageReturn. Whitespace also includes the null string ( Chr(0) ) and the standard space ( Chr(32) ).

seg-source.mrk: Whitespace includes Chr(9) thru Chr(13) which are HorizontalTab, LineFeed, VerticalTab, FormFeed, and CarriageReturn.
Whitespace also includes the null string ( Chr(0) ) and the standard space ( Chr(32) ).

target.mrk: Whitespace includes Chr(9) thru Chr(13) which are HorizontalTab, LineFeed, VerticalTab, FormFeed, and CarriageReturn.
Whitespace also includes the null string ( Chr(0) ) and the standard space ( Chr(32) ).

trans-unit.source: To strip single spaces between words, use the function StringReplace().

seg-source.mrk: To strip single spaces between words, use the function StringReplace().

target.mrk: To strip single spaces between words, use the function StringReplace().

trans-unit.source: Strip leading and trailing whitespace as well as the double spaces (or more) in between the words.

seg-source.mrk: Strip leading and trailing whitespace as well as the double spaces (or more) in between the words.

target.mrk: Strip leading and trailing whitespace as well as the double spaces (or more) in between the words.

trans-unit.source: This is a sentence with whitespace.

seg-source.mrk: This is a sentence with whitespace.

target.mrk: This is a sentence with whitespace.
